reviews.review_text: Fat and unwieldy are two words to describe this game. While it uses many exotic contextual actions, dynamically grabbing pipes, ledges, and other objects in game to ascend to higher safer perches, the game just falls flat on it's face.  I believe the description of this game is a 'vertical' fps, which I think they meant to show by this emphasis on climbing and acrobatics, but I think what went wrong is the aiming, which felt clunky, enemies didn't seem to die fast enough, mostly because you're flipping and climbing everywhere just trying to find the guys, and an overall unappealing level design which was consistent of mostly blank brick buildings and bridges leading to nowhere special.  If you can get over the aiming and the level design, you might be able to take this game. But given the size of the game, I feel like I could use my space better than with this game.

Great USP: vertical gameplay, a lot of ways to aproach enemies, ginormous open levels with almost no skybox, you can walk or climb pretty much everwhere you see. But the execution lacks. Get it in a bundle, but not just so.

Bought this game on sale, really enjoyed it despite the poor weapon handling and aiming. If you can get past that, the parkour elements were decent and the puzzles not too offputting. Interesting world building and story, just keep your expectations low, this is a 2009 game after all.

I don't know what is up with all these people giving negative reviews, but they are grossly overexagerating how bad this game is. Sure, it has it's problems, but if you like steam punk you will at least want to give it a try. Don't go in expecting a masterpiece, and you won't be disappointed. I remember having a blast playing this with my older brother when it first came out on the Xbox 360.
This game is very bad. And that is exactly why it's fun to play coop.
this is a fun game if you can laugh at bugs, and there is alot of bugs in this game, good luck to try and complete it :D

Bought for a couple of bucks. It was fun at first, but got bored of it real quick. I stopped playing after about 5 hours. I just couldn't get past how bad the fighting was. The graphics were less than good, and the sound effects actually kept making me laugh. Every time someone dies, they make this horrific scream that is just out of place. And before they die, the AI just kind of stands there and shoots, offering no kind of tactical process. I'm not upset that I wasted a couple dollars. I hope the developers can put that money to good use and make something better.

The game looked nice and seems to have an interesting backstory. The excution was of poor quality and reminds me of first year coding projects. The controls are not well tuned resulting in failed or slow jumps. The story telling / character dialog is poor making the game hard to enjoy. Most of the issues look easy to fix but have a large impact of the playability of the game.
